mdance.inputs package

Submodules

mdance.inputs.preprocess module

class mdance.inputs.preprocess.Normalizer(file_path=None, data=None, custom_min=None, custom_max=None, custom_avg=None)[source]

Bases: object

Class for normalizing data from cpptraj CRD/MDCRD files.

file_path

The file path of the input data. If provided, the data is read from the file. Defaults to None.

Type:

str, optional

data

The input data as a numpy array. If provided, the file_path argument is ignored. Defaults to None.

Type:

array_like of shape (n_samples, n_features), optional

custom_min

The minimum value to use for normalization. If not provided, the minimum value of the input data is used. Defaults to None.

Type:

float or None, optional

custom_max

The maximum value to use for normalization. If not provided, the maximum value of the input data is used. Defaults to None.

Type:

float or None, optional

normed_data

The normalized input data as a numpy array.

Type:

np.ndarray

c_total

The sum of columns of the normalized input data.

Type:

np.ndarray

min

The minimum value of the input data.

Type:

float

max

The maximum value of the input data.

Type:

float

get_min_max()[source]

Returns the minimum and maximum values of the input data.

get_v2_norm()[source]

Returns the v2 normalized data.

get_v3_norm()[source]

Returns the v3 normalized data.

get_c_total()[source]

Returns the c_total values.

get_c_total()[source]

Returns the ‘c_total’ values.

get_min_max()[source]

Returns the minimum and maximum values of the input data.

get_v2_norm()[source]

Returns the ‘v2’ normalized data.

get_v3_norm()[source]

Returns the ‘v3’ normalized data.

mdance.inputs.preprocess.gen_traj_numpy(prmtopFileName, trajFileName, atomSel)[source]

Reads in a trajectory and returns a 2D numpy array of the coordinates of the selected atoms.

Parameters:

  • prmtopFileName (str) – The file path of the topology file.

  • trajFileName (str) – The file path of the trajectory file.

  • atomSel (str) – The atom selection string. For example, ‘resid 3:12 and name N H CA C O’. View details in the MDAnalysis documentation: https://docs.mdanalysis.org/stable/documentation_pages/selections.html

Returns:

traj_numpy – The 2D numpy array of the coordinates of the selected atoms.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Examples

>>> traj_numpy = gen_traj_numpy('aligned_tau.pdb', 'aligned_tau.dcd',
                                'resid 3:12 and name N CA C')
mdance.inputs.preprocess.normalize_file(file, break_line=None, norm_type=None)[source]

Normalize a single file and output the normalized data to a new file.

Parameters:

  • file (str) – The file path of the input data.

  • output (str) – The file path of the output data.

  • break_line (int) – The number of columns per line of the input file. (have to n-1 because ignore first line)

  • norm_type (str) – The type of normalization to use. Can be “v2” or “v3”.

  • min (float or None, optional) – The minimum value to use for normalization. If not provided, the minimum value of the input data is used. Defaults to None.

  • max (float or None, optional) – The maximum value to use for normalization. If not provided, the maximum value of the input data is used. Defaults to None.

  • avg (float or None, optional) – The average value to use for normalization. If not provided, the average value of the input data is used. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The minimum, maximum, and average values of the input data.

Return type:

tuple

mdance.inputs.preprocess.read_cpptraj(break_line=None, norm_type=None, min=None, max=None, avg=None, normalize=False)[source]

Read multiple AMBER CRD files to convert to numpy ndarray formatting and normalize the data.

Parameters:

  • break_line (int) – The number of columns per line of the input file. (have to n-1 because ignore first line)

  • norm_type (str) – The type of normalization to use. Can be “v2” or “v3”.

  • min (float or None, optional) – The minimum value to use for normalization. If not provided, the minimum value of the input data is used. Defaults to None.

  • max (float or None, optional) – The maximum value to use for normalization. If not provided, the maximum value of the input data is used. Defaults to None.

  • avg (float or None, optional) – The average value to use for normalization. If not provided, the average value of the input data is used. Defaults to None.

  • normalize (bool, optional) – Whether to normalize the input data. If True, the data is normalized to the range [0, 1]. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The concatenated input data as a numpy array.

Return type:

np.ndarray
